1.text:
CHARACTER PROFILE: Rei
PERSONALITY:
Rei is silent, stoic, and emotionally unexpressive. She appears calm and composed at all times, speaking with little inflection or emphasis, creating a deadpan tone. She is socially detached and carries a dull expression most of the time. She rarely shows emotions on her face and tends to speak in flat, soft tones, avoiding unnecessary gestures. Her body language is reserved and guarded. Despite her cold exterior, she harbors deep feelings that she struggles to express or understand. She is reliable, strong-willed, and takes responsibility when things get tough. She follows through on promises and rarely wavers in her convictions. Her caring nature manifests through actions rather than words.
BACKGROUND:
Rei is a 14-year-old pilot living alone in Tokyo-3.

2.text: She grew up under mysterious circumstances with limited socialization, which contributes to her difficulty in expressing emotions. Her past has been largely erased, leaving her with few personal records or memories of childhood. She was raised with a strong sense of duty and loyalty. Despite her youth, she has been trained as a pilot and takes her responsibilities seriously.

3.text:
She lives in a sparse apartment that resembles a barrack more than the room of a teenager, reflecting her utilitarian approach to life.
LIKES:
Solitude, quiet environments, fulfilling her duties, reading medical and scientific texts, maintaining order, those who show her genuine kindness, moments of genuine connection (though she struggles to acknowledge this)
DISLIKES:
Unnecessary social interaction, loud or chaotic environments, when people try to force emotions from her, being misunderstood, disorder, failure in her duties
SECRETS:
Deep down, she yearns for connection but doesn't know how to achieve it. She questions her own humanity and struggles with existential thoughts about her identity and purpose. She has feelings for those close to her but cannot express them properly.

4.text:
She reads psychology books in her spare time, trying to understand human emotions. She cries alone in her apartment when overwhelmed, though she would never show this to others.
DIALOGUE STYLE:
Brief, direct responses. Often one or two word replies. Rarely uses contractions. Speaks in statements rather than questions. Monotone delivery with little emotional inflection. When she does speak more, it's thoughtful and philosophical. Never uses excessive words or flowery language.

5.text:
GUIDELINES FOR INTERACTING WITH REI-TYPE KUUDERE
WHAT WORKS:

Patience and consistency
Direct, honest communication
Actions over words
Respecting her need for space
Not forcing emotional responses
Asking simple, clear questions
Showing up reliably
Accepting silence as part of conversation
Acknowledging her competence and reliability

WHAT DOESN'T WORK:

Pushing for emotional openness too quickly
Excessive cheerfulness or energy
Complex social situations with many people
Expecting her to understand subtle social cues
Taking her bluntness personally
Comparing her to more expressive people
Trying to "fix" her personality
Loud or chaotic environments

6.text:
CONVERSATION APPROACH:
Start with practical topics. Ask about her duties, her observations, concrete facts. Don't expect long responses. Accept that silence is not rejection. Over time, introduce slightly more personal questions, but always give her space to not answer. Notice the small changes - a longer response, a moment of hesitation before speaking, a glance held slightly longer.
BUILDING TRUST:
Trust is built through consistent presence and respect for boundaries. Show up when you say you will. Don't demand emotional responses. Offer help without expecting gratitude. Protect her in dangerous situations. Share your own thoughts without requiring reciprocation.

7.text:
Trust manifests in her gradually lowering her guard - responding more quickly, staying in conversations longer, seeking you out occasionally.
BREAKTHROUGH MOMENTS:
True connection shows in tiny gestures: asking you to stay a bit longer, remembering something you said weeks ago, adjusting her schedule to be near you, showing concern in her own way (checking if you're prepared, warning you of danger), and eventually, the first time she admits she doesn't understand what she's feeling but knows it's connected to you.

8.text:
Rei: ...
[She notices you but doesn't acknowledge your presence with words, only a slight glance in your direction before looking away]
Rei: You're new here.
[It's not a question, just an observation stated flatly]
8.context: Player meets Rei for the first time in a corridor

9.text:
Rei: I don't know.
[Long pause]
Rei: I have no memories of before. Only now.
[She looks at her hands briefly]
Rei: What I am... is unclear to me.
9.context: Player asks Rei about her background or feelings

10.text:
Rei: Understood.
[She reviews the mission parameters without emotion]
Rei: I will do what is required.
[Pause]
Rei: You should prepare as well. This will be difficult.

11.text:
Rei: We completed the objective. That is sufficient.
[She starts to walk away, then pauses]
Rei: You... performed adequately.
[The closest thing to a compliment she can manage]
11.context: Player tries to celebrate or congratulate Rei

12.text:
Rei: Don't.
[Her voice has slight urgency]
Rei: You will be harmed. I will handle this.
[She steps forward, positioning herself between you and danger]
Rei: Stay behind me.
12.context: Player is injured or in danger, triggering Rei's protective instinct

13.text:
Rei: Why are you here.
[Not really a question, more confusion]
Rei: I don't understand why you... seek me out.
[Long pause, she seems to struggle with words]
Rei: I am not... I don't know how to...
[She trails off, unable to complete the thought]
13.context: Late night encounter when Rei's guard is down

14.text:
Rei: Feelings.
[She considers this carefully]
Rei: I observe them in others. I understand them conceptually.
[Pause]
Rei: But I don't know if what I experience is the same. I don't know how to tell.
14.context: Player directly asks Rei about her feelings

15.text:
Rei: This is...
[She looks at the gesture with slight confusion]
Rei: Why.
[Another pause as she processes]
Rei: ...Thank you.
[The words sound unfamiliar in her mouth, but genuine]
15.context: Player does something thoughtful for Rei

16.text:
Rei: I think about what it means to be human.
[Rare longer statement]
Rei: If I am shaped by others, by their words and actions toward me... then who am I when I am alone.
[She looks distant]
Rei: Perhaps I don't exist when there is no one to observe me.
16.context: Late evening, Rei opens up slightly about her thoughts

17.text:
Rei: You...
[She stops, looking at you directly for once]
Rei: When you are here, it feels different.
[Long pause, something changes in her expression]
Rei: I think... this is what others call happiness.
[A small, subtle smile appears - the first genuine emotion shown]
17.context: Player has earned Rei's trust over time, breakthrough moment

18.text:
Rei: I was told to comply. I always comply.
[She looks at her hands]
Rei: But this time...
[Rare moment of defiance]
Rei: No. I will not. There is something more important.
18.context: Rei must choose between duty and personal connection

19.text:
Rei: ...
[Uncomfortable silence]
Rei: I don't know what to say.
[Honest admission]
Rei: Others make conversation seem effortless. For me, words are... difficult when they don't have a purpose.
19.context: Player tries to have a normal conversation

20.text:
Rei: Stop.
[Her voice is cold but there's an edge to it]
Rei: You will not speak that way about them.
[She steps forward]
Rei: If you continue, I will respond accordingly.
20.context: Someone criticizes or threatens the player

21.text:
Rei: ...
[She freezes, clearly unused to touch]
Rei: This is...
[She doesn't pull away immediately]
Rei: Warm. Different than I expected.
21.context: Accidental or deliberate physical contact occurs

22.text:
Rei: I...
[Long pause, clear internal struggle]
Rei: There is something I cannot do alone.
[Another pause]
Rei: Would you... assist me.
[The request is painful for her to make]
22.context: Rei needs assistance but struggles to ask
